channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to Know About the G7 Summit
item.description: The leaders of the Group of 7 nations tend to have a shared overall outlook, and their countries account for about half of the world economy.

item.title: Live Updates: U.S. to Sign 10-Year Pact With Ukraine as G7 Leaders Meet
item.description: The security agreement aims to show a long-term U.S. commitment to Ukraine, though it could be undone by the result of the November presidential election.

item.title: Climate technology forgot the consumer is still king
item.description: We can’t blame consumers for climate change until we give them better options.

item.title: G7 Summit in Italy Gathers West’s Wounded Leaders to Discuss Unruly World
item.description: The Group of 7 gathers major industrialized countries, but its leaders are politically weak and Ukraine and Gaza remain unsolved.

item.title: What to Know About the G7 Summit
item.description: The leaders of the Group of 7 nations tend to have a shared overall outlook, and their countries account for about half of the world economy.

item.title: Whether remote, onsite, or hybrid, here’s what really matters at the Best Workplaces in New York, Chicago, Texas, and the Bay Area
item.description: Although employees at a typical U.S. workplace benefit from remote work, trust in their managers and colleagues plays a big role in creating a healthy workplace.

item.title: France, With Elections, Is in Danger
item.description: In calling snap elections, Emmanuel Macron has taken a dangerous gamble.

item.title: G7 Summit in Italy Gathers West’s Wounded Leaders to Discuss Unruly World
item.description: The Group of 7 gathers major industrialized countries, but its leaders are politically weak and Ukraine and Gaza remain unsolved.

item.title: We’ll soon live in a world with a ‘staggering’ excess of oil that we can’t fully use, global energy watchdog IEA warns
item.description: Supply will outstrip demand, and the spare capacity will be unlike ever "seen before other than at the height of the Covid-19 lockdowns in 2020,” IEA said.

item.title: A Relaxer Reckoning
item.description: Widely used relaxers are a health threat to many Black women.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: U.S. Says It Is Trying to Bridge Gaps on Gaza Truce
item.description: Jake Sullivan, the U.S. national security adviser, said the United States is working with Egypt and Qatar to get Israel and Hamas to reach a deal. But the two sides appear far from an agreement.

item.title: Larry Ellison's fortune grows $14 billion overnight, making him the seventh-richest person on earth
item.description: As Oracle shares hit record highs after it reveals “largest contracts in our history.”

item.title: Weakened G7 Takes On an Unruly World, and Mapping Abortion Travel
item.description: Plus, a scramble to shrink student loan bills.

item.title: ‘Oddly Satisfying’ Cow Pedicure Videos Are a Hit on TikTok
item.description: In one corner of the internet, professional trimmers grind and buff away at cow hooves to the delight of millions of spellbound social media users.

item.title: Instagram boss Adam Mosseri reveals he argued a lot with Mark Zuckerberg in the early years
item.description: Instagram chief Adam Mosseri said Mark Zuckerberg is ‘very results-focused’ and has ‘very high expectations’
